intro: Ischaemum barbatum var. lodiculare, commonly known as the slender beakgrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is a perennial species characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as marshes, meadows, and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
